revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=D-Link |model=DXN-W224 |revision=A1 |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=05/09/2013 |manuf_country=China |manuf=Cameo |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=MoCA bridge |fcc_id=KA2XNW224A1 |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model= |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand=ESMT |ram1_model= |ram1_num=2 |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num=1 |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model= |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if=Mini PCI |wi2_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Atheros |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=2 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} ''Wireless Ethernet Coax Bridge''
"REV:A0-1", "2012/10/22", and a lead-free logo is silkscreened on the main board in the FCC photos. :A lead-free logo and "21514DW224A17A1" is silkscreened on the wireless module.
The FCC external photos show the device as being '''Xfinity''' branded, indicating its use with '''Comcast''''s cable internet service. :The MoCA interface is controlled by an '''Entropic Communications''' chip.
The sample SSIDs shown in the FCC manual are '''HOME-6789-2.4G''' and '''HOME-6789-5G''', which jives with '''Comcast''''s current default SSID format.
A C2PC made 02/20/2014 indicates minor changes have been made w/ the B1 revision (LED direction + a power switch).
